title.narrative: SP Lobby & Advocacy International - restoring the social contract

description.narrative: A stable, peaceful and equitable society in fragile countries in which: Local women and women’s organizations and youth and youth organizations are able to influence and meaningfully participate in decision-making processes, specifically those related to peacebuilding; Security and justice provision is people-centered and security and justice institutions are effective, inclusive and accountable; A resilient health system is in place, contributing to Universal Health Coverage; A sustainable, diversified economy benefits local communities
Communities in fragile contexts.

High level international dialogue, like on SDG16+, and peace negotiations around armed conflicts define the frameworks for national policies in the six programme countries of the strategic partnership: Afghanistan, Burundi, CAR, DRC, Nigeria and South Sudan. Under international pressure the tendency of shrinking civic space can be countered. For these reasons, it is necessary for the programme partners, including local partners, to take part in international dialogue processes.

description.narrative: Counts number of times that partners or CSOs from the intervention countries are present at international meetings relevant to L&A of the programme.

title.narrative: DD4: Number of advocacy initiatives carried out by CSOs, for, by or with their membership/constituency (program cumulative)

description.narrative: Cumulative score for the SP program (Capacitating Change: restoring the social contract in Fragile Contexts) up to date. This includes data from the six program countries (Afghanistan, Burundi, CAR, DRC, Nigeria, South Sudan) and international interventions.

title.narrative: DD3: Number of times that CSOs succeed in creating space for CSO demands and positions through agenda setting, and/or influencing the debate (program cumulative)

description.narrative: Cumulative score for the SP program (Capacitating Change: restoring the social contract in Fragile Contexts) up to date. This includes data from the six program countries (Afghanistan, Burundi, CAR, DRC, Nigeria, South Sudan) and international interventions.

title.narrative: DD1: Number of laws, policies and norms, implemented for sustainable and inclusive development (program cumulative)

description.narrative: Cumulative score for the SP program (Capacitating Change: restoring the social contract in Fragile Contexts) up to date. This includes data from the six program countries (Afghanistan, Burundi, CAR, DRC, Nigeria, South Sudan) and international interventions.

title.narrative: DD2: Number of laws, policies and norms/attitudes blocked, adopted, improved for sustainable and inclusive development (Program year total)

description.narrative: Program year total for the number of concrete changes in policies or laws brought about through lobby and advocacy by the program partners. Adds up scores for international lobby and child projects in countries.

title.narrative: DD2: Number of laws, policies and norms/attitudes blocked, adopted, improved for sustainable and inclusive development (program cumulative)

description.narrative: Program year total for the number of concrete changes in policies or laws brought about through lobby and advocacy by the program partners. Adds up scores for international lobby and child projects in countries.

title.narrative: DD1: Number of laws, policies and norms, implemented for sustainable and inclusive development (Program year total)

description.narrative: Program year total for the number of concrete changes in policy implementation brought about through lobby and advocacy by the program partners. Adds up scores for international lobby and child projects in countries.

title.narrative: DD3: Number of times that CSOs succeed in creating space for CSO demands and positions through agenda setting, and/or influencing the debate (Program year total)

description.narrative: Program year total for the number of times lobby and advocacy targets (decision-makers and power holders) include CSOs in the decision making process or react upon the issues brought forward by the program partners. Adds up scores for international lobby and child projects in countries.

title.narrative: DD4: Number of advocacy initiatives carried out by CSOs, for, by or with their membership/constituency (Program year total)

description.narrative: Program year total. Counts each occasion that the program partners succeed in engaging with a new lobby target (decision-makers and power holders) on an important advocacy topic. Adds up scores for international lobby and child projects in countries.

title.narrative: DD6: Number of implementing partners in security and justice projects (Total program period)

description.narrative: Total score for the SP program (Capacitating Change: restoring the social contract in Fragile Contexts). Each CSO is only counted once in the total. Partner CSOs are NOT added again if they were already counted in previous years to avoid double counting. This includes data from the six program countries (Afghanistan, Burundi, CAR, DRC, Nigeria, South Sudan) and international interventions.

title.narrative: (SP) Number of agreements supported by official documents for the adjustment and design of policies and for and policy implementation
J) Stakeholders support the role of civil society and assure that the voice of communities and minority groups are heard in policy dialogue
C) CSOs and Cordaid increase community awareness on advocacy topics
K) National decision makers initiate policy processes with inclusive civil society engagement
E) Communities organize inclusive dialogue in which women, youth and minority groups can voice their needs and concerns
F) Communities increase their capacity for advocacy towards decision makers
A) Civil society partners (CSOs) and Cordaid increase their capacity to influence and engage in dialogue with policy makers, politicians and companies
M) National and local decision makers adopt inclusive and legitimate policies and laws
N) National government institutions, international development actors and multinational companies implement laws and policies favourable to the target communities with transparent practices & systems
I) CSOs are influential in international multi-stakeholder alliances and platforms
B) CSOs and Cordaid collect local evidence from target groups (with participatory data collection methodologies) for effective lobby and advocacy strategies and knowledge building
D) CSOs organize in networks to build collaborate capacity for lobby and advocacy
L) International development actors support inclusive development and peace and state-building processes in fragile contexts
H) Government institutions, private sector and civil society develop structural dialogue and engagement
(SP) Number of jointly formulated strategies
0) Partners in the SP (Cordaid, MoFA, Embassies, Local CSOs) improve working relationships and coordinate L&A interventions
(SP) Number of Cordaid partners present on international stage as experts and case providers
(SP) Number of CSO recommendations incorporated by international development actors
DD5: Number of CSOs with increased L&A capacities (Total program period)
(SP) Number of capacity building trajectories with participation partners
